snippet: A Times examination found that unlicensed sellers advertise scores of weapons on free classified ads Web sites where people legally barred from gun ownership can buy them.
abstract: Absence of background checks in most private firearms transactions makes illegal buying easy; New York Times examination finds that unlicensed sellers advertise scores of weapons on free classified ads Web sites like Armslist where people legally barred from gun ownership can buy them (Series: Bearing Arms).

byline.original: By MICHAEL LUO, MIKE McINTIRE and GRIFF PALMER
byline.contributor: Sarah Cohen contributed reporting. Jack Styczynski and Jack Begg contributed research.

lead_paragraph: A Times examination found that unlicensed sellers advertise scores of weapons on free classified ads Web sites where people legally barred from gun ownership can buy them.

headline.seo: Internet Gun Sites Ease Illegal Sales
headline.main: Seeking Gun or Selling One, Web Is a Land of Few Rules
headline.print_headline: Seeking Gun or Selling One, Web Is a Land of Few Rules
